_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
McLane Distribution Southwest- Temple, TX operates a Distribution cold storage warehouse.

Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 

A. Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 
It is the Policy of McLane Distribution Southwest, to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The Company's officers, managers and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of McLane Distribution Southwest relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials.

McLane Distribution Southwest has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent releases of extremely hazardous substances. In the development of this plan, McLane Distribution Southwest has used numerous resources both inside and outside the Temple facility. EPA's Risk Management Program and OSHA's Process Safety Management Program provided the guidelines in the development of the Prevention Plan.

In the event of an accidental release, McLane Distribution Southwest has developed and implemented an Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Plan provides guidance for identifying and reporting accidental releases. The Emergency Action Plan includes an incident command system for decision-making authority for each stage of an accidental release. The facility has coordinated with public responders and local emergency services to enhance public safety. 

B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 
Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility.

F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 
Future changes to improve release prevention include addition of new technology as it becomes available, and continued training of plant personnel.

¿	Compliance Audit Procedures 

D. Five-Year Accident History 
No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.
